name.text: Identifying numbers which are divisible by both 5 and 9 from a given list.

questiontext.text:
Which of the following numbers are divisible by both 5 and 9?

[[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
[[ if test="member(1, ta_index)" ]]

A number is divisible by 5 if the last digit digit is 0.

[[/ if ]] [[ if test="member(2, ta_index)" ]]

A number is divisible by 5 if the last digit is 5.

[[/ if ]] [[ if test="member(3, ta_index)" ]]

A number is divisible by 9 if the sum of the digits is divisible by 9.

[[/ if ]] [[ if test="member(1, ta_index)" ]]

A number is divisible by both 5 and 9 if it meets the rule of both 5 and 9

[[/ if ]] [[ if test="member(2, ta_index)" ]]

The number must be a multiple of their least common multiple to be divisible by both 5 and 9

[[/ if ]]

questiondescription.text:
Purity Ekadeli

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1R9ZLYIdNJpq0EwxRIkBibNw1-OtkDNMk_3_NZTezbN8/edit?tab=t.0

The question requires one to identify which numbers are both divisible by 5 and 9. The following rules has to be applied, a number is divisible by 5 if the last digit is 0 or 5. A number is divisible by 9 if the sum of its digits is divisible by 9

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.
